title: Mechatronics Systems Expert (m/f/d)
description: Would you like to work in a highly promising industry in the energy sector and shape the economy of tomorrow in cooperation with big players? As a specialist in assembly systems, our customer is shaping the international electrical and semiconductor industry. Support their team now as Mechatronics Systems Expert (mIfId) in Radfeld, Tyrol.TasksYour main focus will be on Advanced Die Attach technologies and customer roadmaps. This includes the following:You create conceptual mechanical designs for mechatronic systems You will design the interaction between mechanics, electronics, control technology and software You model and optimise modules with a focus on functional and dynamic behaviour (FEM) You work in multidisciplinary project teams to support and develop mechatronic modules and systems with a focus on mechanical architecture, dynamics and vibration dampingTo ensure quality, you plan and interpret functional tests on modules and machines You take care of documentation and reporting to keep everyone involved informedAs you will be working on future technologies, you will regularly liaise with system architects and process specialists to define new goals You will also expand the project teams at times as a consultant and coach You will also work with system architects, process and image processing specialists on metrological tasks You will regularly liaise with product marketing to gain the best possible understanding of customer requirementsRequirementsThe skills you learnt in your Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering or Mechatronics are an asset to our customers. Knowledge from comparable degree programmes is also ideal. Instead of a suitable degree programme, you can also impress with many years of professional experience. As their business language is English, business fluent English skills are required. Previous experience with the FEM method in the mechanical field as well as knowledge in the areas of sensor technology and electronics are a big plus for you, but not a must-have.BenefitsYou can expect a position with exciting, challenging tasks. We can therefore advertise the position with a minimum salary of 4,000 gross. The more professional experience you have, the higher your salary range. Health is a top priority - your company doctor takes care of your well-being every month.Great team spirit, where many events are initiated by employees and every colleague is very welcome In addition to the initiatives taken by employees themselves, there are also numerous team events organised by the company. Great - for them too. Really good work also requires the necessary equipment - so your hardware and software is always up to date. Onboarding new employees is the foundation for a successful and long-lasting professional relationship. That's why your buddy will accompany you during the initial period and ensure that you settle in well at the company.Your lunch is also taken care of - in addition to a meal allowance, you will receive free drinks and snacks. Do you prefer to cook yourself? No problem, you can use their kitchen. Really good work also requires necessary breaks - you can spend these with your colleagues in social and break rooms. Sport is your life? Perfect! Our own fitness room and other sports facilities are waiting for you. If you come to work by car, there's a free car park waiting for you. Do you prefer cycling? No problem, they give you the opportunity to lease bikes with tax benefits.Social projects are important to you? Great! With them you have the opportunity to support them and have a say in the choice of project.Are you interested in working in a company and shaping the future in cooperation with big players? Then apply now!We'll give you all the details in an initial phone call Find Jobs in Germany on Arbeitnow

title: Product Manager (Full-Time) (m/f/d)
description: At United Manufacturing Hub, we make the world of computers and factories one - by putting the most powerful IT & OT tools into the hands of the engineer.  In today's factories, millions of data points are produced every second. Meanwhile, industrial companies face unprecedented pressure to produce with the highest productivity while also keeping sustainability in mind. With UMH, you can connect all data sources on the shop floor with applications and systems with ease, enabling straightforward analytics, leveraging cloud tools, and supercharging your manufacturing with AI.   Future-proofing the production of goods we use and consume daily is a task so immense that no single company can handle it alone. This is why we have made the United Manufacturing Hub and our knowledge open source, creating a caring community to reach that future - united!TasksAs a Product Manager at United Manufacturing Hub, you will deliver business impact by marshaling UMHs resources to identify and solve the most impactful customer problems.  Develop comprehensive plans for upcoming UMH features, incorporating relevant information from various sources.Maintain oversight of the feature plan, balancing ideas, wishes, requirements, customer feedback, and technical considerations from multiple departments.Craft user journeys for product features based on how our user would interact with it, addressing potential issues such as technical constraints, time frame limitations, and managing postponed ideas.Possess a general understanding of technical aspects related to the products.Define and track requirements for each step of product development, ensuring program functionality meets specified criteria.Monitor the implementation of requirements and steps, replacing or deprecating outdated elements.Collect all necessary information for feature implementation.Create designs for software programs, ranging from initial sketches to complete mockups.RequirementsMinimum Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, or a related field (we welcome all disciplines who bring the passion and skills for this role).Ideally 1-2 years of experience in product management.Familiarity with Figma and Github.A collaborative team player with a proactive approach.Eager to learn and adaptive, with the ability to juggle multiple tasks.Structured, hands-on work approach, strong ownership and independence.Strong written and oral communication skills in English and German.Customer-focused mindset and ability to empathize with user needs.Knowledge in the area of industrial IoT would be an advantage.BenefitsProfessional Growth: You will be actively involved in exciting projects and have 100% ownership and responsibility for your tasks. A steep learning curve is guaranteed through our regular feedback sessions.Dynamic start-up atmosphere! This means: fast communication and decision-making channels, flat hierarchies, a talented and motivated team, lots of fun during and after work.Flexibility at Work: Customize your working hours to suit your needs and enjoy the option to work remotely from time to time.Value your Work: Recognition and rewarding of your work with competitive salary packages, company participation (VSOP) and subsidized memberships (e.g. Urban Sports Club, EGYM Wellpass).Modern Workspace: Work in a well-equipped, modern office located in the heart of Ehrenfeld (Cologne) with our company barista during your working day.Do you want to make a difference with us? Then we look forward to receiving your application!
